entry.title: Martin Atkins added 'Oh... And did I mention that he was married?' as a favorite

a:object.title: Oh... And did I mention that he was married?
a:object.content:
My friend Simon texted me yesterday around 3 p.m. and said, "I feel like it's a bottle of wine kind of night." For me, EVERY night is "a bottle of wine kind of night," but I decided to humor him and, just this once, drink my bottle in public amongst friends. Not quite as enjoyable as guzzling it down sipping it slowly while shoving goldfish in my mouth by the fistful savoring delectable rice crackers and watching The Secret Life of the American Teenager The Wire, but whatever. When my people demand my presence, I like to occasionally placate them. I'm a giver.

After three (four?) glasses, my friend Kimmie and her Canadian boyfriend (fingers crossed that's what she's calling him!) decided to head home and do whatever it is that people in long distance relationships do when they see each other fuck. I, on the other hand, am an alcoholic was forced to stay for "just one more" by Simon, so I ordered my fourth (fifth?) glass. Again: I'm a giver. It's just what I do.

It's a well-known fact that I only get hotter as I get drunker, so I imagine at this point in the evening I was looking pretty god damn amazing. At least an "eight."  Who cares if I was maybe slurring my words a little bit or not making any sense... when's the last time you met a guy who gave a shit about a girl's personality or ability to form complete sentences? Exactly.

It was around this time that Simon's co-worker, a typical geeky SF guy with curly hair, glasses and a nerd t-shirt that no girl ever wants to see on her bedroom floor, arrived. He looked me up and down with an expression one normally reserves for rotting road kill, turned to Simon and said, in a voice dripping with disappointment, "You told me there would be two of them."

"Two of what exactly?" I asked Simon as I took a long swig from my glass and immediately shot from a "nine" to a "ten."

"Oh, uh... I told him I was here with two hot girls."

Judging from the fact that this guy's faced looked like it must have when he found out they were cancelling "Battlestar Galactica," I can only assume he'd decided that Simon wasn't even there with *one* hot girl.

And all I have to say to that is... Not my fucking fault someone left his beer goggles at home. We live in San Francisco; he should've known better. He should have known better...

entry.title: Martin Atkins posted an entry

a:object.content: Welcome to Six Apart...

entry.content: Welcome to Six Apart...

entry.title: Martin Atkins added 'Wasabit Kit Kat! Sakura/Green Tea Kit Kat! Thank you @kimmi8!' as a favorite

a:object.title: Wasabit Kit Kat! Sakura/Green Tea Kit Kat! Thank you @kimmi8!
a:object.content:
(that's my fancy hands way of holding multiple Kit Kat's, btw)

Kimmie got these special Japanese Kit Kats in Wasabi and Sakura/Green Tea flavor from the Japanese Six Apart team, and I'm happy to report that they're MINE to EAT! Unfortunately, both Garth & Kimmie report that the Wasabi variety is kind of underwhelming, but that's okay.

DID YOU KNOW that there are a TON of Kit Kat flavors out there? The awesome ones are all available in Japan, like Kit Kat Yakimorokoshi (grilled corn), Kit Kat Ginger Ale, and Kit Kat Pickled Plum (to name a few). Sadly, the closest the US comes to Kit Kat varieties is the Kit Kat Carb Alternatives, a low-carb Kit Kat alternative with 50% less sugar. SIGH.

Check out all the Kit Kat flavors here. Neat!
